meanings.definition: A dish of meat and vegetables cooked slowly in liquid.
meanings.sent1: My mom made a delicious stew for dinner last night.
meanings.sent2: I love to eat a warm bowl of stew on a cold winter day.
meanings.sent3: When the stew bubbled on the stove, it smelled so good.
meanings.sent4: The flavors in the stew blended together like a symphony.
meanings.sent5: The stew was so flavorful, it felt like a party in my mouth.

meanings.sent1: I like to stew the vegetables to bring out their natural sweetness.
meanings.sent2: She decided to stew the meat for hours to make it tender.
meanings.sent3: As the ingredients stewed together, the aroma filled the kitchen.
meanings.sent4: The idea stewed in his mind until he finally took action.
meanings.sent5: The soup was left to stew on the stove until it was just right.

meanings.definition: A state of anxiety or agitation.
meanings.sent1: Her mind was in a stew of worry before the big presentation.
meanings.sent2: The anticipation of the exam put him in a stew of nerves.
meanings.sent3: She couldn't help but stew over the upcoming job interview.
meanings.sent4: The stew of emotions inside her made it hard to focus.
meanings.sent5: The stew of anxiety slowly simmered within her as the deadline approached.
